educations.schoolName: Cesar Chavez High School for Public Policy

headline: Contract Specialist
summary: Exceedingly competent Contract Specialist with 8 years of experience in contract closeout and acquisitions.  Highly detailed-oriented with the ability to work independently on multiple projects simultaneously.  Dedicated to providing innovative procedures to efficiently and effectively process complex acquisitions that result in government cost savings.  Deliver excellent leadership skills when managing individuals of diverse backgrounds to guarantee customer satisfaction.  Possess an immense amount of knowledge in the principles of contracting, specifically the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) to ensure a successful outcome when engaging in business activities with contractors.  Acquired a Bachelorâs Degree in Business Administration with a minor in Acquisitions and Contract Management.  Currently, pursuing a Masters of Business Administration with a minor in Acquisitions and a Federal Acquisition Certification (FAC-C) Level 1 certification contracting.

defaultPosition.description:
â¢Review requisitions to determine that proper specifications/purchase descriptions are included in solicitation documents
â¢Evaluate bids or proposals for compliance with specifications/purchase descriptions and applicable clauses
â¢Procure items awarded through formal advertising and use of negotiation techniques
â¢Administer previously negotiated and formally advertised contracts
â¢Consider financial responsibility of suppliers by evaluating contract performance on previous contracts
â¢Review solicitations and amendments for adequacy and completeness
â¢Monitor vendor performance for compliance with terms and conditions of the award
â¢Participate with higher-level specialist in procurement using formal advertisements
â¢Participate as a team member on an Acquisition Management Review Team or equivalent assignments

positions.title: Contract Specialist

positions.description:
â¢	Lead a team of Contract Analysts on contracts based initiatives 
â¢	Review contracts contained in OpenText archives and database
â¢	Identify relevant contract information
â¢	Classify contracts based on type and content
â¢	Enter contract information on contract management system
â¢	Update and manage online contract management system
â¢	Facilitate meetings and translate requirements into defined business solutions
â¢	Train new Contract Analysts on project requirements and respond to questions from Contract 
 Analysts working both locally and remotely 
â¢	Interface with OpenText Contract Managers/attorneys regarding requirements, problems and 
 work plans and to work with other functional teams at OpenText involved in the project, 
 including Legal, Information Technology and Finance
positions.title: Team Lead/Acquisition Specialist

positions.description:
â¢Prepare appropriate documents for contract files to be closed out in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) 4.804 and NIST policy and procedures. 
â¢Perform analyses and reconciliations of financial transactions including invoices, Government payments and audit reports
â¢Input contractual data into internal and external business management and financial systems 
(i.e., ComprizonSuite [C-Request and C-Award], Commerce Business Systems Portal [CBS], and Federal Procurement Data System [FPDS] to ensure proper closeout of orders  
â¢Prepare memoranda to obtain Contracting Officer Representative (COR) certification that all goods/materials have been received or that all services have been completed
â¢Verify all contractual invoices have been submitted and paid before closing a contract
â¢Draft modifications for the Contracting Officerâs (CO) approval and signature to assist the Government to recover any unexpended funds (i.e., unliquidated obligations [ULO])
â¢Prepare appropriate forms and completion statements to be signed by the CO to effectuate closeout
â¢	Provide monthly reports of closeout activities to government personnel and management
positions.title: Contract Specialist

positions.description:
â¢	Provide leadership, technical support, and direction to contract closeout team tasked with completing a variety of contract closeouts such as IDIQâs, Cost Plus Fixed Feeâs, Cost Reimbursable, Cost Sharing, Time and Materials, Labor Hour, Firm Fixed Price, Fixed Price, Sole Source, Task Orders, Delivery Orders, Purchase Orders, Interagency Agreements, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, Blanket Purchase Agreements, De-obligations and Undelivered Obligations (UDOâS).
â¢	Evaluate contracts, subcontracts, and invoice information to ensure closeout documentation and packages are submitted to the government in compliance with DCMA/DCAA, FAR, and contractual terms and conditions and audit requirements
â¢	Perform cost analysis by reconciling contract funding obligations and expenditures within the governmentâs financial system.
â¢	Prepare and suspend final vouchers for submission to the payment office. 
â¢	Audit contractorâs cost proposals to determine indirect, direct, allocable, allowable, and unallowable costs.
â¢	Read and interpret contract terms and conditions including indirect cost rate agreements and audit reports.
â¢	Apply contractorsâ indirect cost rates to their indirect costs categories (overhead, g&a) to determine accurate indirect costs data.
â¢	Assist the Contracting Officer in negotiating Quick Closeouts in accordance with FAR 42.708
â¢	Submit contractual data in Federal Procurement Data System (FPDS), Comprehensive Acquisition Management System (CAMS) Departmental Contracts Information System (DCIS) to finalize closeout actions. 
â¢	Attend and conduct meetings with the Contracting Officer, Contracting Officer Representative, Division Directors, and management pertaining to contract closeout.
â¢	Conduct interviews of potential employees and conduct yearly performance evaluations of current employees.   
â¢	Create and distribute monthly reports to the Contracting Officer and management, which capture closeout numbers, deobligation amounts, challenges, and procedures.
positions.title: Team Lead of Contract Closeout

positions.description:
â¢	Workload required closing over 2,000 inactive contracts (dated 1990 to 2010) and all current/future contracts for Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS).
â¢	Reviewed expired contracts and task orders to determine their type, contract limitations, contract periods, types of costs, legal status, indirect rates and ceilings when applicable.
â¢	Verified accuracy of contractorsâ indirect cost rate agreements.
â¢	Read and interpret contract terms and conditions including indirect cost rate agreements and audit reports.
â¢	Applied contractorsâ indirect cost rates to their indirect costs categories (overhead, g&a) to determine accurate indirect costs data.
â¢	Verified contractorsâ fee retention amounts and ensure that the contractor is paid their full fee after contract completion. 
â¢	Reconciled contractorâs previous paid invoices against agency financial data to ensure that the contractor accurately billed the government for their direct and indirect costs.
â¢	Prepared and suspend final vouchers for submission to the payment office. 
â¢	Determined disallowed costs and deobligation funding in CAMS and DCIS.  
â¢	Performed desk audits on contracts to reconcile direct and indirect costs billed during the term of the contract by applying the indirect cost rates by year.
â¢	Assisted in writing and editing of CMS contract closeout policy and guidebook.
â¢	Served as the Back-up to the Records Liaison Officer (RLO) and the Vital Records Coordinator (VRC), ascertains monitoring, compliance, and determining which records within (OAGM).
â¢	Abided by the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and Health and Human Services Acquisition Regulations (HHSAR) when closing contracts.
positions.title: Contract Closeout Specialist

positions.description:
â¢	Supported contract closeout activities for IDIQâs, Cost Plus Fixed Feeâs, Cost Reimbursable, Cost Sharing, Time and Materials, Labor Hour, Firm Fixed Price, Fixed Price, Sole Source, Task Orders, Delivery Orders, Purchase Orders, Interagency Agreements, Blanket Purchase Agreements, De-obligations and Undelivered Obligations (UDOâS).
â¢	Examined and evaluated contract financial history, perform indirect cost adjustment analysis, provide solutions to resolve contract settlements.
â¢	Managed workload by utilizing information management systems including automated financial management systems and procurement data systems.  
â¢	Maintained closeout management reports and responsible for records management.
positions.title: Contract Closeout Analyst

positions.description:
â¢	Inventoried and Queried MAIC database for Contract Files, assigned Closeout Files to Data Analyst. 
â¢	Conducted training sessions for Data Analyst for closing and reconstructing contracts in Procurement Request Information System (PRISM).
â¢	Performed contract closeout functions and document status using the checklist and the automated tracking system.  
â¢	Physically reconstructed Contract Closeout Files for Data Analysis and final disposition of records and prepared Contract files in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulations 4.804 (FAR).
positions.title: Data Analyst II / Contract Closeout Specialist

positions.description:
â¢	Prepared Contract files in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulations 4.804-5 (FAR).
â¢	Verified payment history in the Federal Financial Management Systems (FFMS) Accounting database.
â¢	Prepared modifications for closeout in the Procurement Request Information System (PRISM).
â¢	Assembled contract files for archiving for the Federal Record Center (FRC).
positions.title: Data Analyst I / Contract Closeout Specialist
